title: International Community Energy Living Labs
summary: This research aims to create practical solutions for energy communities by examining various international living labs. The International Community Energy Living Labs (ICELL) research project aspires to develop a systematic screening method to design fossil-free energy systems, addressing the technical, behavioral, regulatory, and legal challenges of developing energy communities. It prioritizes attainable zero-emission strategies and energy justice with the community as a key stakeholder.
green_innovation: TRUE - This project addresses various aspects of environmental sustainability by developing fossil-free energy systems and prioritizing zero-emission strategies in energy communities.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article does not describe a specific new or improved product or business process introduced to the market; it focuses on research and systematic screening methods.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not mention a specific good or service that fits the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The research aims to develop processes for creating fossil-free energy systems and addresses various operational challenges while promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221118 - Other Electric Power Generation; 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services; 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Biotechnology); 913910 - Other Local Government Activities.
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not engage in misleading information about environmental benefits, as it focuses on genuine research for energy communities.
